TextBlock.Text: OKALIS: How do you suppose this rock achieves its behavior? It appears to move exclusively when it is unobserved.
SENNETTI: Perhaps it is some form of macroscopic quantum behavior? It may exist in all locations at the same time, but collapses to a single possibility once observed by a conscious being.
OKALIS: An interesting idea! This may indeed be the case, I can think of no other explanation for how it may relocate itself so dramatically.

AZOLLA: While this is an interesting find, it is a shame that it does not seem to be useful to our current goals. I had hoped that this would help us locate the <color=orange>Eye of the Universe</color>.
NESIA: Actually, I believe that I may have accidentally found an additional behavior of this rock. When <color=red>TEXT OBSCURED</color> it seems that <color=red>TEXT OBSCURED</color>.
AZOLLA: Even more interesting, but I still fail to understand how this would aid us in reaching the <color=orange>Eye</color>.

NESIA: I am still putting together the details (in particular, I want to bring Karenia to observe this phenomenon), but I believe that this may be useful to a proposal of mine that I am calling the <color=orange>Distant Node Project</color>. I encourage you all to join me here sometime when I have more of the details worked out. I will be able to explain the idea in full then.
NESIA: If this is the case, it may hint at the nature of the <color=orange>Eye</color> as well. This rock seems to emanate a signal similar to the one reverberating through this area.
